The iconic cardboard box was inspired by a real-life story of a Japanese spy who used a similar method to hide.
Psycho Mantis's 'mind-reading' was achieved by reading the player's memory card.
The sound of the alert '!' is the same as the sound of a truck's backup warning in Japan.
The character of Revolver Ocelot is a tribute to the actor Lee Van Cleef, who played similar roles in spaghetti westerns.
The name 'Solid Snake' is a reference to Snake Plissken from the movie 'Escape from New York'.
The 'La-li-lu-le-lo' are the Patriots, a secret organization that controls the world's information.
The character of 'The End' can be defeated by saving the game and waiting a week, causing him to die of old age.
The original Metal Gear was released on the MSX2 computer in 1987.
Hideo Kojima's original idea for Metal Gear Solid was to have it set in a building, not an island.
